name: Studios Intro Page
summary: The Engagement Lab works with faculty across the campus to create dynamic studios that respond to real world problems. Studios take a number of different forms, from short term engagements to year-long partnerships.
gradSummary: A small group of graduate students works with a partner on a design challenge as whole or partial requirement of their degree.
coCurricularSummary: The co-curricular studio can be taken for up to two non-tuition credits. Students work with external partners who frame a problem space - i.e. data surveillance in Boston, use of VR for civic engagement, etc. The studio is a place for generative thinking about wicked problems. Faculty encourage students to apply the knowledge and skills they have while reaching outside of their comfort zone to imagine new applications and new solutions.
partneredCurricurlum: Partnered Studios are 1 semester courses where Emerson students work with a partner organization tackling a social issue. Students go through a full research, participatory design, and evaluation process with the partner. Students learn about project management, design thinking, and agile prototyping. Our partners learn about co-design in an academic, low-risk, and exploratory setting. Together, we make way on an entrenched social issue.
partneredSummary: Partnered Studios are 1-semester courses where Emerson students work with a partner organization tackling a social issue.
partneredCurriculum: Students go through a full research, participatory design, and evaluation process with the partner. Students learn about project management, design thinking, and agile prototyping. Our partners learn about co-design in an academic, low-risk, and exploratory setting. Together, we make way on an entrenched social issue.
gradCurriculum: Thesis Partners could be local government offices, environmental agencies, community organizations, human rights groups, transportation, and housing advocates, and so on. Partners will visit the Media Design program in Fall and share the work of their organization and the specific challenges they are engaged in.
initiativesSummary: Initiatives are multi-year collaborations facilitated by the Engagement Lab with explicit social impact goals. Initiatives center community-based partners and work with faculty, students, and other stakeholders to define impact goals and work toward those goals through partnered studios and other collaborative activities.
